original_title: ADB may provide $400M to Sri Lanka over next three months
original_body_lines: EC0NOMYNEXT – Manila based Asian Development Bank may be able to provide about 400 million US dollars to Sri Lanka once an International Monetary Fund review and some reforms are completed, Country
A 200 million US dollar budget support loan could be provided as early as December 2023, if an IMF review is completed, Kadono told a forum organized by Sri Lanka’s Ceylon Chamber of Commerce.
A 100 million US dollar loan based on power sector reforms could come in January 2023.
If a power reform bill was approved earlier, the funds could have been provided in 2023 itself he said.
A 100 million dollar loan for small and medium loan and a credit agency could be provided in the January – February 2024 period.
The ADB was also looking at supporting the social safety net program.
